comments: Make sure you really want to write a thesis.
Writing a thesis is a great learning experience, but make sure you have a good adviser (which I am lucky to have) outside of 985 and start collecting data over the summer.

This class provides you support through the thesis process. However, it does not provide you much support in trying to pick a topic. You need to come in with an idea in order to  make progress. Also, you will have to turn in little things for milestones, but  you do not get much feedback about them. Also, the certain section you are does not matter at all. They all basically do the same thing.
Do a lot of preparation for your thesis work during your junior year and if possible over the summer.
If you are really passionate about writing a thesis, then take this course.
Well, you gotta do it to write a thesis...
These sections are not that helpful, but I think writing a thesis is a great experience to get to know the ec department better and to see your accomplishments in ec.
Well, you have to take it to write a thesis, oh well.
Write a thesis and take this seminar -- you'll be grateful for the time it helps you carve out of your schedule to get your work done.
Start on your research early. Getting started in junior year is highly recommended.
Writing a thesis is a rewarding experience if you find an adviser with a vested interest in you and your subject. Do not seek out well known faculty if they do not have an interest in your project.
Unless you have a good topic and a helpful advisor, don't take this course.
You need to take it to write a thesis. Stas is helpful and guides you along well.
Doing a thesis is an extremely rewarding experience. Do it!
If you want to write a thesis, take this course!
Make sure you have an idea of what you would like to write about and make sure you're really excited about your thesis topic.
Stas is great! He is well-acquainted with the process of writing a thesis. He was very helpful throughout the semester.

I learned a lot in a short amount of time. The Stata problem sets are horrible and you might as well just go to office hours rather than spend lots of hours spinning your wheels. Eventually you will come to appreciate stata but only after working through it yourself on your own thesis towards a goal. Also, definitely try to have a topic ready before the semester begins, it would make the process a lot easier.
